Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
@Alright  migrate_createburntransaction add the full token creation tx (from the src chain) to the burn tx opret,
then migrate_createimporttransaction constructs new token opret for the dest chain plus it adds the complete burn tx to the import tx opret. So the opret is going to grow even more than we consider it above üòÄ

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: We need this to validate the source token params on the dest chain

Author: Alright#0419

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
actually it should return invalid for funcid='c'. We should not be here as token creation tx should not go over validation  code as it does not have cc inputs (only normal inputs).
We get into the token validation code when token is being spent (that is when funcid = 't')

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: if we get here for 'c' it means incorrect funcid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just add 30% (or something like that)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: keep it simple. if it doesnt fit with 30% to spare, then a different burn tx needs to be made

Author: dimxy#2587
Content:
yes I was going to suggest 50% opret for the burn tx size, but seems 30-40% is better
We may also provide that it won't add small normal inputs to burn txns

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I use a heuristic in utxo selection that most always works on the first pass. If the utxosize is < total/N, I skip it,where N is the max vins

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that way, it adjusts the utxos uses based on the total amount needed.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there could be times where a more efficient utxo selection would work, but i think if it is possible to fund the payment, this algo will do it

Author: dimxy#2587
Content: now it is N=60 in the create burn transaction rpc (for coins), so it is better to have a lower value like 5-10
